Line1.C1CD0: Why have you come? (Why have you come?)
Line11.C1CD0: Hmm. He sought the way to summon Lilith. But he made another stop on the way, to a place beyond the Tree’s sight. (Beyond the Tree's sight...)
Line15.6D03F: I've damn near lost count of how many times we’ve killed him.
Line17.C1CD3: So that’s why Taissa failed so dismally to reclaim his head.
Line19.6DE47: This place Elias stopped at, how can we get there?
Line21.C1CD0: Seek a coffin beyond the wrecks. It will take you where you must go. Find out what secrets linger there, for the Tree knows not.
Line3.6D03F: We’re after a man named Elias.
Line5.C1CD2: (Elias!) Elias. Slippery, that one. He owes the Tree. It deals in thoughts. An insight, in exchange for a head.
Line7.C1CD3: He is the first of us to escape payment.
Line9.6DE47: Will you tell us what you told him? If we can stop him for good, the Tree can finally collect.
